string.text: Hi
Greetings!
Where's the payment for the job I did?
Go and see my assistant. He's got it
Okay. But no tricks this time...
Who are you?
Leha the Jaw they call me! And these tramps - my brigade!
What are you and your people doing here?
My children and I are taking a rest here. Then we're going on to Pripyat
What do you know about Pripyat?
I know it's an old, abandoned city from the epoch of communism.\nNow it's just crowded with Monolithians and mutants. Those who have gone before me did not return. Not one...
Don't you think it rather dangerous to go there, then?
There's no doubt about that. You're right. But I'm sure it's worth trying
Did you see any military nearby?
No, fortunately. It's been quite a while since they showed up here
Not even Military Stalkers?

I heard some of them appeared in the region of Radar, near the antennas. Once they were shut down, many people started traveling to Radar, and further beyond to Pripyat! But we haven't met anyone else coming from the Warehouses since we arrived. Quite likely, someone has blocked the road to here
Blocked? By whom, do you think? The Military?

As I said, the Military haven't shown up for a long time, so it could've been the Military Stalkers. They're tough bastards, those guys, and they work together as a team. I'm surprised they didn't block the road earlier...
Wouldn't it be more practical for them to go ahead to Pripyat, and simply block the entrance there?
I don't know. Maybe they're afraid, or they're preparing for something. It's pointless trying to second-guess them
Okay. Well, do you have a task for me?
Well, there is one. But it's not easy. Are you still interested?
Sure. I'm not afraid of hard work
Actually, I was hoping for something quick. Sorry, you're better finding somebody else
I understand. I don't mind admitting I'm afraid of doing the job myself, and I'd rather pay someone else than risk the lives of my people. What a pity...

Excellent! So, here's your task. My scouts, Loma and Log, were sent to Pripyat to check how bad the situation really is there, but they didn't return. Try to find them alive, and bring them back safely. If this isn't possible, at least bring their guns back. They were good ones, and we need them here! I'll give you 2,000 if you do this for me
Sounds fair. I'll bring your men back. Or their weapons...
2,000 for Pripyat? You can't be serious. The job's got to be worth at least 4,000
I'm sorry, Stalker. 2,000 is all I can offer
Excellent. I'll wait here for you!
This is Marked One reporting. The task is done
Perfect! Give me his PDA!
Hold on, friend. First show me the money
Bastard. He doesn't have anything on him!
Fuck this, and stop messing me about. Unless you're challenging me?
It'd be simpler just to kill you...
Okay, I understand. Good luck, then...
I can't give you anything. There's no money left. But if you want, you can have his stuff
Thanks, but I have no interest in his stuff. Never mind. Consider it a gift
I've not found him yet
Well, better hurry up if you want your money, Stalker
I found your men, but they were dead. I can't tell what killed them - I had to pry them out of a chimera's claws. Their weapons seem to be intact. Here they are

Shit. Those were my best men. Now with them gone, I think there's no sense in going to Pripyat. I don't want to lead my men on a suicide mission! There's one problem, though. I cannot pay you for the job. My assistant ran away with all our money. Please understand, Marked One
Don't worry, I'll find him! Tell me where he went. And don't try to cheat me. You're a lot closer to me than he is...

I don't think he could have got far. I'll note it on the map - here. If you find him, bring him back to us, and we'll 'take care' of him. Although if he were to have an 'accident' on the way, his PDA would be enough. Understand?
Wait here for me. I'll bring your PDA
No luck yet...
Well, look harder! I can't wait here forever
